Thanks for the answers

I decied to bought this sword,maybe a stupid thing =
to do whitout seeing it "live" .But anyway, i liked the "look" of it.....(8=
00$ including shipping)
Talked to the owner,he had recived this sword as a =
gift from an older couple that had have this on the wall in their cabin, th=
e man in that couple bought it in the 1920=B4s on a trip in a unknown count=
ry.
He had helped them for some years whith the garden and so, and when the=
y decied to sell the cabin they asked him if he wanted anything from the ca=
bin,he just did think that the sword looked nice, (no intreset in japanese =
swords at all), so he took that and an old TV.
He will not take the Tskua o=
f it, he was scared that he gonna destroy it.
Hopefully i gonna recive it u=
nder this week, gonna post some pics of the tang it when i have it in my ha=
nds. (and if it says "made in China", i let you know :-)

Best Regards

Pat=
rik
